intro: Orthocarpus linearilobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
